{"step_by_step_thinking": "MHC Class II proteins are expressed by antigen-presenting cells. According to the documents, these include B-cells, dendritic cells, and macrophages. Platelets and T-cells do not express MHC Class II proteins. While all nucleated cells can express MHC Class II proteins, they are not normally expressed by all nucleated cells, but rather by professional antigen-presenting cells.", "answer_choice": "A"}
